title: Verify: Logged in Xbox Live account is required to access app content
custom_preconds:
-No Xbox Live user account is signed in
-MLB.tv app is installed on the device
custom_steps:
1. Select the MLB.TV app tile (in Apps section on Xbox dashboard)

-App launches-
custom_expected:
The user will receive an access gate (Xbox Live Sign In prompt screen displays)
AND we will be unable to continue without first logging in to Xbox Live.

SELECT "Sign In" button opens the external MS Xbox Live Sign in app/menu.

title: Verify: Logging in to Xbox Live account at Sign In prompt, then allows access to app content
custom_preconds:
-No Xbox Live user account is signed in
-MLB.tv app is installed on the device
-Internet connection and MS Xbox Live is up and running
*Sandbox specific Xbox Live account required
custom_steps:
1. Select the MLB.TV app tile (in Apps section on Xbox dashboard)
-App launch & Xbox Live Sign in prompt displays-
2. Select Sign in
-the external MS Xbox Live Sign in app/menu opens-
3. Sign in with (*valid) Xbox Live user account
custom_expected: App proceeds to Home screen.

title: Verify: Selecting MLB.tv successfully opens MLB.tv when signed in to an Xbox Live account
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their Xbox One system
AND has installed the "MLB.tv" app
AND is signed in to an Xbox Live account
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects the "MLB.tv" app from the menu
custom_expected: THEN the "MLB.tv" app will open successfully

title: Verify: Launch MLB.tv from Pin successfully opens MLB.tv (when signed in to an Xbox Live account)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their Xbox One system
AND has installed the "MLB.tv" app
AND has Pinned the MLB.tv app to their home menu
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects the "MLB.tv" app from the Pin menu
custom_expected:
THEN the "MLB.tv" app will open successfully

Note: the result must take into account the user's Home view preference; Home, Today, Postseason - for the purpose of this test, any success is accepted as a Pass

title: Verify: MLB.tv app can be accessed while the Xbox One is connected wirelessly
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their Xbox One
AND the system is currently connected to a wireless network
AND the MLB.tv app is installed
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects the MLB.tv app from the menu
custom_expected: THEN the MLB.tv app will open successfully

title: Verify: MLB.tv app can be accessed while the Xbox One is connected using a wired connection
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their Xbox One system
AND the system is currently connected to a wired network connection
AND the MLB.tv app is installed
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects the MLB.tv app from the app menu
custom_expected: THEN the MLB.tv app will open successfully

title: Update: Verify user's settings are kept intact when updating to new version
custom_preconds: When an update for the app becomes available and is installed, the app should remember the user's settings that were set before the update.
custom_steps:
1. Install version 1.0 
2. Log in with valid user account 
3. Set user profile settings and note what they are
4. Update app
5. launch app and signing with user account used in step #2
custom_expected:
User settings are remembered/acknowledged after update install.

- show/hide scores
- HOME video tile on/off
- favorite team(s)
- Show Stadium backgrounds on/off

App performs without issue.

title: Home Team Prompt: Verify Home Team prompt displays (Beginning season specific test)
custom_preconds:
-MLB.tv app is installed on the device
-Internet connection and MS Xbox Live is up and running
-Xbox Live user account is signed in
-2015 update installed
-app has not been launched since update
- account that has not been previously linked

-Does NOT matter if mlb.com user account is signed in (Home Team is saved locally)
custom_steps: 1.launch app
custom_expected:
2016 Season 1st launch message displays; a.k.a. Home Team prompt

Text - Welcome & info about new feature to choose a Home team for default Home view.
Button Choices:  [Choose Home Team] and [Close]

title: Home Team Select: Verify Home Page Team Select displays

-2016 update installed
-app has not been launched since update
[C48925]
custom_steps:
1.launch app
- Home Team prompt/2016 Season 1st launch message displays-
2. Activate Choose Home Team button on controller to select Home Team
custom_expected:
Home Team Select screen displays with:

- Select Your Home Team (header)
- a navigable list of all MLB teams

title: Home Team: Verify Team Home page displays once selected (1st launch)
custom_preconds:
[C48926]
-MLB.tv app is installed on the device
-Internet connection and MS Xbox Live is up and running
-Xbox Live user account is signed in
-2016 update installed
-app has not been launched since update
custom_steps:
1.launch app
- Home Team prompt/2016 Season 1st launch message displays-
2. Choose Select Home Team 
3. Select a Home Team from list
custom_expected:
Team Home Page displays.
Team logo and name display at top of screen, with a selection of the 3 most recent and/or upcoming games, mlb.com curated video clips, stats, and more... (TBD).

The Home Team is stored locally; it is not communicated back to mlb.com profile service (unlike Favorites).

title: Today Home: Verify Today Home displays if no Home Team is selected

[C48926]
-MLB.tv app is installed on the device
-Internet connection and MS Xbox Live is up and running
-Xbox Live user account is signed in
-2015 update installed
-app has not been launched since update
custom_steps:

- Home Team prompt/2015 Season 1st launch message displays-
2. Select NO Home Team
The prompt/message closes

Today/Home view displays. 
This is the default view seen in the 2014 version(s) of the app: Today and Yesterday display on the main screen with additional button to navigate to Calendar, Settings, Standings, etc. (The new feature of Featured videos will be added for 2015 season.)

title: Login: Verify Login message opens; if mlb.com user account is not logged in and attempts to access game content
custom_preconds:
-MLB.tv app is installed on the device
-Internet connection and MS Xbox Live is up and running
-Xbox Live user account is signed in
-mlb.com user account is NOT signed in
custom_steps:
1. Launch the app
2. Select any Live or archived game tile
custom_expected:
THEN we will be presented with a SIGN IN screen
AND an Email Address field will be present
AND a password field will be present
AND a SIGN IN button will display underneath

title: Login: Verify Login message opens; when Selecting LOG IN button (in Settings)
custom_preconds:
-MLB.tv app is installed on the device
-Internet connection and MS Xbox Live is up and running
-Xbox Live user account is signed in
-mlb.com user account is NOT signed in
custom_steps:
1. Navigate to the Settings button (on Home screen) and select; or press Menu button on controller and select Settings
2. Select LOG IN button
custom_expected:
THEN we will be presented with a SIGN IN screen
AND an Email Address field will be present
AND a password field will be present
AND a SIGN IN button will display underneath

title: Login: Verify Login success
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed MLB.tv
AND we have not previously logged into an account
custom_steps:
WHEN we access the MLB.tv app
AND we go to Settings and select SIGN IN
AND we enter valid mlb.com credentials
custom_expected:
THEN the credentials will be accepted 
AND we will be logged in
AND we will see ACCOUNT ACTIVATED message

title: Login: Verify Login failed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the MLB.tv app
AND we have not previously logged into an account in the channel
custom_steps:
WHEN we access MLb.tv
AND we enter invalid MLB.com credentials
custom_expected:
THEN a Login Error Message will appear under the Password field
AND a message regarding 'Invalid email or password' will be stated
AND all formatting and text will be readable

title: Login: Verify text and formatting are clear and readable
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed MLB.tv app
AND we are on the Login Screen
custom_steps:
WHEN we look at the Text
AND we look at the buttons
custom_expected:
THEN we will see that the text is spelled correctly on the page
AND each label is formatted correctly

title: Login: Verify after incorrectly entering credentials the user is able to enter credentials again
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the MLB.tv app
AND we have entered Invalid credentials at the Login Screen
custom_steps: WHEN we see the login error text
custom_expected:
THEN we will be able to navigate back to the Email and password fields
AND we will be able to attempt to enter credentials again

title: Login: Pressing the Back button from the Login Screen returns the user to the previous screen
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed MLB.tv app
AND we are on the Login Screen

Note: Login screen displays when attempting to access game content without an entitled user signed in, or when Login button is selected from Settings menu.
custom_steps: WHEN we press the Back (B) button
custom_expected:
THEN we will be returned to the previous screen.

option 1: Settings
option 2: Game day

title: Home: Verify when MLB.tv is accessed via Deep-link the user lands on the Home screen

AND we have previously logged in
AND the XB1/device and dev tools/Windows computer are connected on the same network 
Xbox One Command Prompt type: xbapp connect <tools IP>

Xbox One Command Prompt type:

xbapp launch "ms-xbl-5CCF99D4://"
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be brought to the Home Screen:

 - if Home Team has been selected; Team Home page displays

 - if Today has been selected; Today Home page displays

 - if *Postseason has been selected; Postseason view page displays


*With Postseason enabled and configured

title: Show Video on Home option unchecked: verify video does not display on Today
Show Video on Home option checked: verify video displays on Today
Verify Calendar opens to the current Month
custom_steps: 1. On Home, select Calendar button
custom_expected:
Screen updates to display the current month's game schedule, with:

- Today's date marked with "Today"

- Calendar View Option button ("all teams"/specific team)
- Month
- Arrow buttons (on either side of month) for navigating to previous/next month
- Days of the week
- Day tiles w/number of games scheduled per day

title: Verify arrow UI button navigates to previous and next months
custom_steps:
1. At Calendar note the current month displayed
2. Navigate and select the on screen buttons:

 - Left Arrow  
 - Right Arrow


Navigate back and forward though the months to the beginning/end of what is available.
custom_expected:
Screen updates to correctly display all text, buttons and design elements of the previous month when Left arrow is selected.

Screen updates to correctly display all text, buttons and design elements of the next month when Right arrow is selected.

title: Verify Calendar Team Selector correctly displays
custom_steps:
1. From Home, select Calendar
2. Select Calendar view Option button in the upper left corner (text reads: ALL TEAMS)
custom_expected: Screen updates to display Team picker: navigable Grid of all teams and an "All Teams" button

title: Verify Team Calendar correctly displays selected team's scheduled games
custom_steps:
1. From Home, select Calendar
2. Select Calendar view Option button in the upper left corner (text reads: ALL TEAMS)
3. Choose Team
custom_expected:
Screen updates to display the current month's game schedule, with Today's date marked.

Team Calendar displays:
- Calendar View Option button displays Team logo and name
- Month
- Arrow buttons (on either side of month) for navigating to previous/next month
- Days of the week
- Day tiles with scheduled game(s)- (if any)

title: Verify Team Future Game Tiles cannot be activated
custom_steps:
1. From Home, select Calendar
2. Select any day beyond TODAY
3. In Day View, activate any tile
custom_expected: Future tile is disabled

title: Verify Calendar allows navigation to previous (2) seasons & current
Verify user is able to view Spring Training vs. (last) regular season standings - This test is applicable only for releases scheduled around ST
custom_preconds: User is running app and has access to current Spring Training and 2014 Standings
custom_steps:
1.From Today (home screen) OR from context menu (controller: menu button)
2. Select Standings; observe Spring Training standings
3. Activate [TBD?] to toggle to (last season's) Standings and observe
4. Activate [TBD?] to toggle to Spring Training Standings
custom_expected:
Step 2: User should see accurate Spring Training Standings. If unplayed, all teams should be shown tied at 0.
Step 3: User should see final (last season's) MLB Standings.
Step 4: App should toggle back to Spring Training Standings.

title: Verify user is able to view Wild Card vs. Regular season standings - This test is applicable only for releases scheduled around Post Season
custom_preconds: User is running app and has access to current Spring Training and 2014 Standings
custom_steps:
1.From Today (home screen) OR from context menu (controller: menu button)
2. Select Standings; observe Regular season standings
3. Activate [Y] to toggle to Wild Card Standings and observe
4. Activate [Y] to toggle to back to Regular Standings
custom_expected:
Step 2: User should see accurate Regular (current season) Standings.
Step 3: App should toggle to Wild Card Standings.

title: Show Scores (test steps needed)
Show Stadium Backgrounds
Show Video on Home
Pick Home Team
Pick Favorite Teams
Home Screen Preference: Home Team
Home Screen Preference: Today
Home Screen Preference: Postseason (only displays when external config set to 'True', during postseason)
***Logout: Verify choosing Logout options successfully logs the user out of their account
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the MLB.tv app
AND we have successfully logged in with an MLB.com account
custom_steps:
WHEN navigate to the Settings section
AND we select Log Out
AND we confirm we wish to logout by re-selecting log out on the Log out confirmation screen
custom_expected:
THEN we will be successfully logged out of our mlb.com account
AND we will be returned to the Settings page
AND Logout button will update to say "Log In"
AND the logged out user's profile settings and entitlements will be cleared (and not be stored locally).

title: ***Logout:  Verify once logged out, previously accessible paid content can no longer be accessed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the MLB.tv app
AND we have successfully logged in with an MLB.com account
custom_steps:
WHEN navigate to Settings
and we select Log Out
custom_expected:
THEN we will be logged out of the MLB.tv account
AND we will be unable to further access any paid mlb.com content that we could previously access

title: Logout: Verify after selecting Log Out, user is given a confirmation prompt
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the MLB.tv app
AND we have successfully logged in with an MLB.com account
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to Settings
AND we select Log Out
custom_expected:
THEN we will receive a confirmation prompt
AND the message will have two options:
LOGOUT 
BACK

title: Logout: Verify choosing BACK from the confirmation prompt, user is brought back to Settings and is still logged in
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the MLB.tv app
AND we have successfully logged in with an MLB.com account
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to Settings
AND select the Log Out option
AND the confirmation prompt comes up
AND we select BACK
custom_expected:
THEN the Confirmation Prompt will dismiss
AND we will be brought back to Settings
AND we will still be logged into the mlb.com account

title: Logout: Verify choosing Logout from the confirmation prompt, user is logged out
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the MLB.tv app
AND we have successfully logged in with an MLB.com account
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to Settings
AND select the Log Out option
AND the confirmation prompt comes up
AND we select LOGOUT
custom_expected:
THEN the Confirmation Prompt will dismiss
AND we will be logged out
AND we will be brought back to Settings
AND only Log In, Home Team and Home Screen Preference settings will be enabled.

title: ***Logout: Verify user's credentials are not maintained after logging out
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the MLB.tv app
AND we have successfully logged in with an MLB.com account
custom_steps:
WHEN we go to Settings
AND we complete the Log Out process
AND we navigate back to the login screen from Settings
custom_expected:
THEN our previously logged in credentials will not be populated in the Email/Password fields
AND we need to fill in our credentials again

title: ***Verify if the user's profile access rights update that these are reflected in the app's viewable content
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the MLB.tv app
AND we have successfully logged in with an MLB.com account
custom_steps: WHEN the accounts' access rights/profile are updated on the mlb.com website
custom_expected:
THEN the changes will be reflected in the application
AND the newly restricted content will be hidden/removed
OR the newly unrestricted content will now be available

REPEAT for both circumstances

title: ***Verify: Confirm that logging out as one user and logging in as another access rights behave accordingly (unrestricted to restricted)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the MLB.tv app
AND we have successfully logged in with an MLB.com account
AND the account has premium entitlement
custom_steps:
WHEN navigate to Settings
AND we select Log Out
AND we login with an account that DOES NOT HAVE premium entitlements
custom_expected:
THEN the new user will be unable to view the previously unrestricted content
AND the content will be restricted accordingly

title: ***Verify: Confirm that logging out as one user and logging in as another access rights behave accordingly (restricted to unrestricted)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the MLB.tv app
AND we have successfully logged in with an MLB.com account
AND the account is not Premium entitled
custom_steps:
WHEN navigate to Settings
AND we select Log Out
AND we login with an account that has Premium entitlement
custom_expected:
THEN the new user will be able to view the previously restricted content
AND the content will have no access right issues

title: Verify Post Season View Landing Page displays at 1st launch after installed update (and Post Season Welcome message is dismissed)
custom_preconds: Post Season (2) release The app has not been launched or had settings adjusted
custom_steps:
WHEN MLB.tv app is launched in Post Season 
AND the Postseason Welcome message has been viewed and dismissed
custom_expected:
THEN the Postseason view will display:

- Postseason Logo displays in upper right corner
- landing page features hubs for
--World Series
--Champion Series
--Division Series
--Wild Card

Note: The series in focus matches the default series ID of the editorial file.

User can then scroll left/right to view each of the series
And bring each of the game tiles and more buttons into focus.

If a user navigates all the way to the right they will see season Postseason highlights and then options to access Standings, Calendar and Settings

title: World Series (section): Verify large tile and All Series Games (buttons) display as expected
custom_preconds:
WHEN MLB.tv app is launched in Postseason 
AND we are in Postseason view at the landing screen

Test with 'scores' on
Test with 'scores' off
Test with VOD
Test with Live game

Note: some of these conditions may not be replicated true to life in QA for Postseason games.
custom_steps: WHEN we observe the World Series section (hub)
custom_expected:
THEN the section will display:
-Header: World Series
-Large Tile with:
-- American and National league logos
-- WS game number in banner along the bottom
-- Editorial Header (the headerOverrideLine1 from the *config file)
Pregame  User will see the team logos, Date & Time, 
In Game - User will see the team logos, Current Score, Bases, B/S/O
Postgame - User will see the team logos, final score,Winning/Losing/Save Pitcher Info
---w/ Scores on: 
---- If game is in-progress, scores are present, inning is displayed and game status is present
---- If game is over, final score is present and the pitching stats appear.
---w/ Score off: 
---- If the game is over, only 'Final' should appears in the game tile along with the two team logos
---- If game is in-progress, only 'in-progress' appears in the game tile along with the two team logos.

AND
- All Series Games (button) - takes user to World Series games screen


ref:
* http://qa.mlb.com/mobile/postseason/2015/postSeasonScheduleConsoleConfig.xml, Prod: http://mlb.mlb.com/mobile/postseason/2015/postSeasonScheduleConsoleConfig.xml (COMING SOON)

title: World Series: Verify WS All Series Games (button) opens World Series games page
custom_preconds:
WHEN MLB.tv app is launched in Postseason 
AND we are in Postseason view at the landing screen

Test with 'scores' on
Test with 'scores' off
Test with VOD
Test with Live game

Note: some of these conditions may not be replicated true to life in QA for Postseason games.
custom_steps:
WHEN we observe the World Series Section
AND select the WS All Series Games tile
custom_expected:
THEN the World Series Games page will open 
AND the page will display:
-Post Season logo in upper right corner
-World Series Banner at left edge
-Five (up to Seven if necessary) WS game tiles
-- Team logos (Pre-postseason American and National league logos display; after champions hare determined, team logos display)
-- WS game number in banner along the bottom game tile

Pregame  User will see the team logos, Date & Time, 
In Game - User will see the team logos, Current Score, Bases, B/S/O
Postgame - User will see the team logos, final score,Winning/Losing/Save Pitcher Info

---w/ Scores on: 
---- If game is in-progress, scores are present, inning is displayed and game status is present
---- If game is over, final score is present and the pitching stats appear.
---w/ Score off: 
---- If the game is over, only 'Final' should appears in the game tile along with the two team logos
---- If game is in-progress, only 'in-progress' appears in the game tile along with the two team logos.

title: Championship Series (section): Verify ALCS & NLCS small game tiles and All Series Games tiles display as expected

WHEN MLB.tv app is launched in Postseason 
AND we are in Postseason view at the landing screen

Test with 'scores' on
Test with 'scores' off
Test with VOD
Test with Live game

custom_expected:
THEN the section will display:
-Header: Championship Series
-Small tiles with:
-- Team logos
-- Game banner along the bottom (in color AL/NL)
-- Editorial Header (the headerOverrideLine1 from the *config file)

Pregame  User will see the team logos, Date & Time, 
In Game - User will see the team logos, Current Score, Bases, B/S/O
Postgame - User will see the team logos, final score,Winning/Losing/Save Pitcher Info

---w/ Scores on:

---- If game is over, final score is present and the pitching stats appear.
---w/ Score off:

---- If game is in-progress, only 'in-progress' appears in the game tile along with the two team logos.

AND
- All Series Games (button) - takes user to Championship Series games screen

* http://qa.mlb.com/mobile/postseason/2015/postSeasonScheduleConsoleConfig.xml, Prod: http://mlb.mlb.com/mobile/postseason/2015/postSeasonScheduleConsoleConfig.xml (COMING SOON)

title: Verify: User receives an access gate if they have not logged in
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their system
AND the  device is currently connected to an Internet connection
AND the "MLB.tv" app is installed
AND the user has not previously accessed the channel
custom_steps:
WHEN the "MLB.tv" app is accessed
AND a game is selected
custom_expected:
THEN the user will receive an access gate
AND we will be unable to continue without first logging in

title: Verify: User will NOT receive an access gate if they have previously logged in
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their Xbox One
AND the device is currently connected to an Internet connection
AND the "MLB.tv" app is installed
AND we have already logged into the MLB.tv with an account
custom_steps: WHEN we access the MLB.tv from Xbox Home screen
custom_expected:
THEN the access gate will not be encountered
AND the user will be brought mlb.tv Home screen

title: Play: Verify user is able to play LIVE video over a wired connection
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have the XB1 connected to a wired network connection
GIVEN we have installed MLB.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
custom_steps:
WHEN we locate a LIVE video feed
AND we attempt to play this
custom_expected:
THEN the video stream will launch successfully
AND the feed will play without issue

title: Play: Verify user is able to play LIVE video over a wireless connection
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have the XB1 connected to a wired network connection
GIVEN we have installed MLB.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
custom_steps:
WHEN we locate a LIVE video feed
AND we attempt to play this
custom_expected:
THEN the video stream will launch successfully
AND the feed will play without issue

title: Play: Verify user is able to play VOD video over a wired connection
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have the XB1 connected to a wired network connection
GIVEN we have installed MLB.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
custom_steps:
WHEN we locate a Video On Demand (archive) video feed
AND we attempt to play this
custom_expected:
THEN the video stream will launch successfully
AND the feed will play without issue

title: Play: Verify user is able to play VOD video over a wireless connection
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have the XB1 connected to a wired network connection
GIVEN we have installed MLB.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
custom_steps:
WHEN we locate a Video On Demand (archive) video feed
AND we attempt to play this
custom_expected:
THEN the video stream will launch successfully
AND the feed will play without issue

title: Play: Verify video playback launches in full screen
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have the XB1 connected to a wired network connection
GIVEN we have installed MLB.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
custom_steps:
WHEN we locate a LIVE video feed
AND we attempt to play this
custom_expected:
THEN the video playback will launch
AND the playback will be full screen

title: Play: Verify In-Player Navigation UI appear for 15 seconds after any button is pressed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed MLB.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
custom_steps:
WHEN we launch a video feed
AND we tap any button
custom_expected:
THEN the In-Player Navigation UI overlay the video playback
AND after 15 seconds they disappear
AND tapping any button again will repeat the appearing function

title: ***Play: Verify that linear playback can continue for up to at least 2 hours without issue
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed MLB.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
AND there is a LIVE game
custom_steps:
WHEN we attempt to Play the event
AND we receive the Playback Option prompt
AND we select "Live"
AND we stay in the Linear stream for at least 2 hours
custom_expected:
THEN playback will continue as expected
AND the user will not be kicked out of the stream

title: ***Play archived game: User chooses "Beginning" from Playback Option Prompt
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed MLB.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
AND there is an archived game
custom_steps:
WHEN we attempt to Play the video (no options present - will auto-launch "From Beginning"
AND we observe the playback
AND we back out
AND we attempt to Play the same video 
AND we receive the feed select prompt
AND we select "Beginning"
custom_expected:
THEN the video playback will start
AND the location will be at the beginning in both cases
AND when the feed reaches the end the user will be returned to their original access point.

title: ***Play LIVE game: User chooses "Beginning" from Playback Option Prompt
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed MLB.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
AND there is a LIVE game
custom_steps:
WHEN we attempt to Play the video
AND we receive the feed select prompt
AND we select "Beginning"
custom_expected:
THEN the video playback will start
AND the location will be at the beginning
AND when the feed reaches the end the user will be returned to their original access point

Note: When started from beginning, the user may scan forward or select LIVE UI option to advance to the live point in the stream.

title: ***Play: User chooses "Live" from Playback Option Prompt
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed MLB.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
AND there is a LIVE game
custom_steps:
WHEN we attempt to Play the video
AND we receive the feed select prompt
AND we select "Live"
custom_expected:
THEN the video playback will start
AND the location will be at the current LIVE location
AND when the feed reaches the end the user will continue into the next scheduled show

**User will have been placed into the Linear feed by choosing Live**

title: ***Play: User chooses "Resume" from Playback Option Prompt
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed MLB.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
AND there is a bookmarked game (a game that has been previously viewed and exited before reaching completion)
custom_steps:
WHEN we attempt to Play the video
AND we receive the feed select prompt
AND we select "Resume"
custom_expected:
THEN the video playback will start
AND the location will be at the last location viewed when previously played

title: XR-03: Verify app acknowledges change in User entitlement when switching XBlive accounts during playback
refs: MLB.TV CU10 - Final 1 - MLBX5CCF99D4-  Certification Fai
custom_steps:
1. Sign into an Xbox profile linked to a publisher account.
2. Ensure that the console is set as the users Home console and launch the title.
3. From the main menu, select any full game and proceed into media playback by selecting a HOME or AWAY feed.
4. Press the Xbox button to constrain the title.
5. Access the Xbox Home account picker and sign out of the Xbox profile mentioned in step [1].
6. Sign back into the Xbox profile mentioned in step [1] and resume the title.

BAD RESULT FROM XB1 FAILURE:
7. From the Sign In screen, select Sign In > the Xbox profile in use.
8. Observe that the title remains on the Sign In screen.
custom_expected: The title must allow the user to resume use of the title following a sign-in change.

title: ***Network: Verify bandwidth/stream quality adapts with network fluctuations
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed MLB.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
AND we are currently connected using a wireless ad hoc network
AND we begin playing a video
custom_steps:
WHEN we throttle the network connectivity (using Terminal Commands for our Ad Hoc Network)

> EX:
> sudo ipfw add 1 pipe 1 src-port 80
> sudo ipfw pipe 1 config bw 3000KByte/s
> sudo ipfw pipe 1 config bw 500KByte/s
> sudo ipfw pipe 1 config bw 75KByte/s
> sudo ipfw delete 1


or use network line conditioner
custom_expected:
THEN we will see the bitrate adapt
AND the video playback will adjust accordingly based on the connectivity of the wireless ad hoc network

title: ***Network: Verify video quality improves with connectivity improvement
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed MLB.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
AND we are connected to an Ad Hoc network
AND the connectivity has been throttled to a lower byte setting
custom_steps:
WHEN we begin playback
AND we slowly increase the available connectivity speeds
custom_expected: THEN the video quality will improve to a higher bitrate as the connectivity improves

title: ***Network: Verify when throttling connection strength that bitrate playback adjusts without issue in both directions
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed MLB.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
AND we are currently connected using a wireless ad hoc network
AND we begin playing a video
custom_steps:
WHEN we throttle the network connectivity using Terminal Commands for our Ad Hoc Network to lower the connectivity speeds
AND we throttle the network connectivity to increase the connectivity speeds
custom_expected:
THEN we will see the quality of the video adjusts in both directions in correlation with the connectivity speed

Note:  XB1 has a cache of about 30 seconds of video, so if internet connection is downgraded, lost, restored, there is a 30 second delay between the update in status and the video playback reflecting the change.

title: Verify pre-roll cannot be skipped
custom_preconds:
Recap/Highlight player and Archived content will make a call for ads if response returns a valid response, the pre-roll ad is inserted automatically...and if the VAST manifest includes midrolls they would be inserted also.

Currently only pre-roll ads are expected.
custom_steps:
When pre/mid-roll ad is playing:
 attempt to Scan fwd  or Skip forward though the ad
custom_expected:
The user cannot FF through an ad, but can pause and back-navigate.

If the user rewinds past or to an ad that has already played once, the ad is skipped.  (If the user then leaves the player page and returns, the ad will be shown again)

title: Verify pre-roll only plays once per video launch; once the ad completes, user cannot scan back to it
Verify transition from ad to video playback is smooth (i.e. no waiting)
Verify Player Controls function as expected
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed MLB.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
custom_steps:
WHEN we launch a video feed
AND we tap A controller button
AND the In-player UI overlay appears
AND we attempt these displayed controls
custom_expected:
THEN the controls will function as displayed:
> A :Select
> d-pad controllerleft/right; nav l/r through UI
> controller LB/RB buttons; nav left right through prev/next milestone in timeline
> B : Exit Playback

title: Verify In-Player Navigation toggles to alternate views
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed MLB.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
custom_steps:
WHEN we launch a video feed
AND we tap A button
AND the Player Controls overlay appears
custom_expected:
THEN the default Navigation UI presented will be the *GAME picker
AND when we select Up (or Down) menu Arrows
Then the In-Player navigation UI will toggle to LINESCORE and CONTROLS




*Only Today's games display in the in-player picker

title: LIVE: Verify that Live button is available for live streams
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed MLB.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
AND there is a LIVE game
AND we play the Live Linear video stream from the Beginning or any point before the present LIVE point in the stream,
custom_steps: WHEN we open In-Player navigation UI and observe the CONTROL options
custom_expected:
THEN the LIVE option will be enabled
AND when we select LIVE
THEN the video stream will update to the live point accordingly.

title: CC: Verify that Closed Captioning is available for live streams
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed MLB.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
AND there is a LIVE game
custom_steps:
WHEN we play the Live Linear video stream
AND we attempt to toggle on Closed Captioning
custom_expected: Then the Closed Captioning will turn on accordingly

title: CC: Verify that Closed Captioning is available for Video on Demand streams
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed MLB.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
AND there is an archived game
custom_steps:
WHEN we access any VOD archive content
AND we begin playback
custom_expected:
THEN we will be able to successfully enable Closed Captioning
AND we will be able to successfully disable Closed Captioning

title: CC: Verify that setting is retained
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed mlb.tv
AND we have launched a stream
AND we have enabled Closed Captioning
custom_steps:
WHEN we exit the application
AND we launch a new stream
custom_expected: THEN the Closed Captioning setting will still be ON when we access the application again

title: CC: Verify user can toggle Closed Captioning "On"
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed MLB.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
custom_steps:
WHEN we access a video stream
AND playback begins
custom_expected: THEN we can turn Closed Captioning ON

title: CC: Verify user can toggle Closed Captioning "Off"
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed MLB.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
custom_steps:
WHEN we begin video playback
AND we turn on Closed Captioning
AND we attempt to turn OFF Closed Captioning
custom_expected: THEN Closed Captioning will stop appearing for the video feed

title: CC: Verify user Closed Caption status is properly reflected
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed MLB.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
AND we have begun video playback
custom_steps:
WHEN we turn Closed Captioning ON
OR we turn Closed Captioning OFF
custom_expected: THEN the current CC status will be properly reflected in the on screen controls

title: CC: Verify System Closed Caption status is properly reflected
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed MLB.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
AND we have begun video playback
custom_steps:
WHEN we turn Closed Captioning ON 
OR we turn Closed Captioning OFF in Xbox One system Settings
custom_expected: THEN the current CC status will be properly reflected on screen during video playback

title: Markers: Verify user selects a milestone marker that the user is properly brought to the appropriate location
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed MLB.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
AND we are watching video with milestones
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate on the timeline to milestone marker 
AND we attempt to play the milestone
custom_expected:
THEN playback will begin at the appropriate Milestone marker
AND it will be the appropriate milestone as described in the marker

title: Marker: Verify text and formatting is clear and readable for Milestone captions
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed MLB.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
AND we are watching video with milestones
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate through milestone markers on the timeline
AND we look at the thumbnails and text
custom_expected:
THEN all text will be spelled correctly
AND all thumbnails will be formatted correctly
AND all text will be displayed without issue

title: Video: Verify incremental Rewind speed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed MLB.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
custom_steps:
WHEN we enter a video stream
AND we attempt to Rewind
AND we press the REW control multiple times
custom_expected: THEN the REW speed should increment accordingly

title: Video: Verify incremental Fast Forward speed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed MLB.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
custom_steps:
WHEN we enter a video stream
AND we attempt to Fast Forward
AND we press the FF control multiple times
custom_expected: THEN the FF speed should increment accordingly

title: AUDIO: Verify Change Audio menu
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed MLB.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
AND we play a live or archived game (with more than 1 audio feed available)
custom_steps:
WHEN we open In-Player navigation UI and select the CONTROL options
And select the CHANGE AUDIO option
custom_expected:
THEN the CHANGE AUDIO feed menu will open over the video playback
AND when we toggle between the radio feed they will be in focus
AND when we select an audio feed
THEN the audio stream will update to the selected feed accordingly.

(The issue in which the lower bitrates would not support alt audio has been fixed as of 1.16.0.0)

title: GAMES: Verify Today's Games are displayed in correct order
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed MLB.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
AND we launch a video feed
AND we tap A controller button
AND the In-Player Navigation UI overlay the video playback
custom_steps:
WHEN we observe the Games UI
AND scroll left and right through the game tiles
custom_expected:
THEN today's games will display (excluding for the game you are currently watching)

Default view-  
o Favorites teams first
o Games display in order of soonest start time 1st (live at front of list and Final games at end)

After you switch games, the last game you were watching is pushed to the beginning to the list in order to make toggling between two games quicker. 

Note: If you are watching an archived from a previous day, that game is NOT added to the beginning of the list.  The list will only ever contain todays games.

title: GAMES: Verify Game tile statuses update
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed MLB.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
AND we launch a video feed
And there is at least 1 Game scheduled today
AND we tap A controller button
AND the In-Player Navigation UI overlay the video playback
custom_steps: WHEN we observe the Games tile(s)
custom_expected:
THEN the tiles will display game status in real time.

Example: 
 o Scheduled game displaying Start time, updates to display Warmup> Top 1st >...> Final
Game status updates within *30 seconds of play (balls, strikes, outs, on base, score, inning)

As as games transition from scheduled, to in progress, to final, the games status is reflected in real time in the game tile.

title: LINESCORE: Verify Linescore updates as game progresses
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed MLB.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
AND we launch a Live video feed
AND we tap A controller button to open In-Player Navigation UI
custom_steps: WHEN we navigate to Linescore option
custom_expected:
THEN the current game's linescore will display.

IF Scores OFF:
THEN Linescore displays 9 innings with dashes "-" in place of linescore data.

IF scores ON:
THEN Linescores displays 9+ innings with linescore data updating in *realtime 


*MF data score data updates at end of inning.

title: Launch Audio Feed - Confirm Appearance
custom_preconds: Feed Select for a live game is open and at least one Audio Feed is available.
custom_steps: Activate any Audio Feed.
custom_expected:
Confirm:
+background matching game's current venue displays with Teams, date, team logos and radio broadcast info
+feed launches as expected; expected audio plays
In Player UI displays:
 ++ Linescore (if scores are ON), other wise data is replaced by "-"
 ++ Games (Todays games)

title: Feed Playback
custom_preconds: Audio feed has been successfully launched and is playing back expected audio.
custom_steps: Confirm audio plays through from near beginning to completion.
custom_expected: Audio plays back as expected and jumps out to view launched from upon completion.

title: Pause/Play and Exit
custom_preconds: Audio feed has been successfully launched and is playing back expected audio.
custom_steps:
1. During playback, select the (pause) button in the player UI
2. Then select the (play) to resume.
3. Tap controller [B] to exit.
custom_expected: Confirm playback stops at pause (does not pause and hold position in stream - this is OK and as expected), resumes from live position at resume and exits Audio Player to page launched from at activation.

AND we have accessed the app

AND the In-player UI overlay *appears

* Audio Player differs from Video player in that progress bar/timeline and Milestone data is not displayed above game tiles.
custom_expected:

> d-pad controllerleft/right; nav l/r through UI

After you switch games, the last game you were watching is pushed to the beginning to the list in order to make toggling between two games quicker.

title: GAMES: Verify Game tile statuses update
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed MLB.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
AND we launch a video feed
And there is at least 1 Game scheduled today
AND we tap A controller button
AND the In-Player Navigation UI overlay the video playback
custom_steps: WHEN we observe the Games tile(s)
custom_expected:
THEN the tiles will display game status in real time.

Example: 
 o Scheduled game displaying Start time, updates to display Warmup> Top 1st >...> Final
Game status updates within *30 seconds of play (balls, strikes, outs, on base, score, inning)

As as games transition from scheduled, to in progress, to final, the games status is reflected in real time in the game tile.

title: LINESCORE: Verify Linescore updates as game progresses
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed MLB.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
AND we launch a Live video feed
AND we tap A controller button to open In-Player Navigation UI
custom_steps: WHEN we navigate to Linescore option
custom_expected:
THEN the current game's linescore will display.

IF Scores OFF:
THEN Linescore displays 9 innings with dashes "-" in place of linescore data.

IF scores ON:
THEN Linescores displays 9+ innings with linescore data updating in *realtime 


*MF data score data updates at end of inning.
